Module org.monarchinitiative.phenol.annotations
Package org.monarchinitiative.phenol.annotations.base.temporal

Interface PointInTime

All Superinterfaces:
TimelineAware
All Known Subinterfaces:
Age
public interface PointInTime extends TimelineAware
PointInTime is an instant on a timeline with the lowest resolution in days.

PointInTime is located either on the gestational timeline (TimelineAware.isGestational()) or on the postnatal timeline (TimelineAware.isPostnatal()).

PointInTime can be open (isOpen()) or closed (isClosed()). The open PointInTimes represent instants that happened in unspecified past or future. Use openStart() to get the PointInTime for instant in unspecified past, and openEnd() to get the PointInTime for instant in unspecified future. Note, this has nothing in common with a concept of including/excluding range endpoints.

Use compare(PointInTime, PointInTime) for default sorting of the PointInTimes. The sorting uses the following invariants:

  • gestational PointInTimes are before (less) than postnatal PointInTimes, and
  • openStart() is before (less) and openEnd() is after (more) than any gestational or postnatal PointInTime.

  • Field Details

    • MAX_YEARS

      static final int MAX_YEARS
      To prevent numerical overflow, creation of a PointInTime corresponding to more than 2,000 Julian years (730,500 days) is not allowed. 2,000 years should be enough for our use case of modeling life-span of organisms.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MAX_DAYS

      static final int MAX_DAYS
      To prevent numerical overflow, creation of a PointInTime corresponding to more than 2,000 Julian years (730,500 days) is not allowed. 2,000 years should be enough for our use case of modeling life-span of organisms.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • lastMenstrualPeriod

      static PointInTime lastMenstrualPeriod()
      Returns:
      PointInTime representing the last menstrual period before the conception.

    • birth

      static PointInTime birth()
      Returns:
      PointInTime representing birth.

    • of

      static PointInTime of(int days, boolean isGestational)
      Create a PointInTime to represent a specific day on a timeline.
      Parameters:
      days - a day to represent on the timeline.
      isGestational - true if PointInTime is on gestational timeline false.
      Returns:
      a PointInTime instance.

    • openStart

      static PointInTime openStart()
      Returns:
      PointInTime to represent an instant that occurred in unspecified distant past.

    • openEnd

      static PointInTime openEnd()
      Returns:
      PointInTime to represent an instant that occurs in unspecified distant future.

    • days

      int days()
      Get the number of days since start of the timeline. This is the number of days since lastMenstrualPeriod() for gestational timeline and since birth() for postnatal timeline.

      The number is non-negative.

      Returns:
      the number of days.

    • isOpen

      boolean isOpen()
      Returns:
      true if the PointInTime is open.

    • completeWeeks

      default int completeWeeks()
      Get the number of complete weeks present between lastMenstrualPeriod() or birth() and this PointInTime. Each week has 7 days. The number of weeks is non-negative.

      For instance, there are 2 complete weeks in 20 days, 3 complete weeks in 21 days, and so on.

      Returns:
      the number of weeks.

    • completeMonths

      default int completeMonths()
      Get the number of complete months present between lastMenstrualPeriod() or birth() and this PointInTime. A month is defined as one twelfth of a Julian year and Julian year consists of 365.25 days.

      The number of months is non-negative.

      For instance, there are 2 complete weeks in 20 days, 3 complete weeks in 21 days, and so on.

      Returns:
      the number of months.

    • completeYears

      default int completeYears()
      Get the number of complete Julian years present between lastMenstrualPeriod() or birth() and this PointInTime. Julian year consists of 365.25 days.

      The number of years is non-negative.

      Returns:
      the number of years.

    • isClosed

      default boolean isClosed()
      Returns:
      true if the PointInTime is closed.

    • isZero

      default boolean isZero()
      Returns:
      true if the PointInTime represents a beginning of a timeline.

    • isPositive

      default boolean isPositive()
      Returns:
      true if the PointInTime does not represent a beginning of a timeline.

    • isBefore

      default boolean isBefore(PointInTime other)
      Returns:
      true if this PointInTime occurs before the other.

    • isAtOrBefore

      default boolean isAtOrBefore(PointInTime other)
      Returns:
      true if this PointInTime occurs at the same time or before the other.

    • isAfter

      default boolean isAfter(PointInTime other)
      Returns:
      true if this PointInTime occurs after the other.

    • isAtOrAfter

      default boolean isAtOrAfter(PointInTime other)
      Returns:
      true if this PointInTime occurs at the same time or after the other.

    • isAt

      default boolean isAt(PointInTime other)
      Returns:
      true if this PointInTime occurs at the same time as the other.

    • max

      static PointInTime max(PointInTime a, PointInTime b)
      Returns:
      the greater PointInTime based on comparing a and b using compare(PointInTime, PointInTime). a is returned in case of a tie.

    • min

      static PointInTime min(PointInTime a, PointInTime b)
      Returns:
      the smaller PointInTime based on comparing a and b using compare(PointInTime, PointInTime). a is returned in case of a tie.

    • compare

      static int compare(PointInTime x, PointInTime y)
      A comparator-like function for default sorting of PointInTime instances.

      The sorting uses the following invariants:

      • gestational PointInTimes are before (less) than postnatal PointInTimes,
      • a PointInTime with fewer days is less than a PointInTime with more days,
      • openStart() is before (less) and openEnd() is after (more) than any closed PointInTime.
